intro: Plectaneia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf plectanea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. Plectaneia microphylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
